Compliance description: Check if the code includes methods to collect raw data from databases, APIs, sensors, web scraping, or user inputs.
Verify if the code includes logic to extract data from structured (CSV, SQL databases) and unstructured (PDFs, images, text) sources.
Assess whether the code includes functionality to merge multiple data sources while resolving inconsistencies.
Verify if the code maintains structured metadata, including source details, timestamps, and schema definitions.
Ensure that the code implements dataset versioning to track different versions for reproducibility and rollback capabilities.
Evaluate whether the code correctly implements storage solutions, such as data lakes, warehouses, or distributed systems, based on requirements.
Check if the code masks or anonymizes sensitive data while preserving analytical utility.
Assess whether the code includes checks to maintain data quality and consistency throughout preprocessing.
Ensure the code implements authentication, authorization, and encryption for model security.
Check if the code includes mechanisms to track shifts in input data distribution.
Ensure the code maintains logs of predictions, failures, and user feedback for debugging.
